info.headline: Tropical Storm Warning issued October 09 at 9:17PM ChST until further notice by NWS Guam
info.description: ...TROPICAL STORM BOLAVEN MOVING WEST-NORTHWEST TOWARDS THE MARIANAS... .NEW INFORMATION... The Tropical Storm Warning has been upgraded to a Typhoon Warning for Rota. .AREAS AFFECTED... This local statement provides important information and recommended actions for people in Guam and the Northern Marianas, along with adjacent coastal waters. .Watches/Warnings... A Typhoon Warning has been issued for Rota. A Typhoon Warning remains in effect for Tinian and Saipan. A Tropical Storm Warning remains in effect for Guam. A Typhoon Watch remains in effect for Guam. A Tropical Storm Watch remains in effect for Agrihan, Pagan, and Alamagan. A Flood Watch is in effect for all of Guam, Rota, Tinian and Saipan Monday afternoon through Wednesday. .STORM INFORMATION... At 7 PM ChST...the center of Tropical Storm Bolaven (15W) was located near LATITUDE 11.5N and LONGITUDE 149.0E. This was about 310 miles east-southeast of Guam. Storm motion was west-northwest at 12 mph. Storm intensity was 70 mph. .SITUATION OVERVIEW... Bolaven continues to strengthen and approach the Marianas, and the track has shifted slightly south with a passage through the islands but still favored to be in-between Rota and Tinian Tuesday evening. When making decisions, do not focus on the exact forecast track. Little wiggles in storm path are still possible and can really matter. Continue to keep up with the developing situation. .PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... For those under a warning, now is the time to rush to completion preparations for the protection of life and property. Evacuate if directed to do so by local officials, or if your home is vulnerable to high winds or flooding. Heed the advice of local officials and comply with any orders that are issued. For interests at ports, docks and marinas, urgently complete prescribed preparations according to your emergency operations plan for tropical cyclones. If you live on a boat, make final preparations for securing your craft before leaving it. Closely monitor NOAA weather radio or other local news outlets for official storm information. Listen for possible changes to the forecast. For additional precautionary and preparedness information, please refer to detailed recommendations from your local emergency management agencies. && .NEXT UPDATE... The next local statement will be issued by the National Weather Service in Tiyan around 3 AM ChST Tuesday morning, or sooner if conditions warrant. ...THE TROPICAL STORM WARNING HAS BEEN UPGRADED TO A TYPHOON WARNING... ...PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Keep informed and listen for possible changes to the forecast. Comply with any evacuation orders issued for your area. If you live in a corrugated roof home, make plans to evacuate. Gather clothes, important papers, medicines, and small valuables and keep them ready to go on short notice. Gas up your vehicles and have extra cash on hand. Regarding your home or business, cover all windows and doors with shutters or plywood. Move patio furniture and other loose objects indoors. Brace all exterior doors, including garage doors. && ...TIMING AND PROBABILITY OF TROPICAL STORM/TYPHOON CONDITIONS... The onset of tropical storm conditions could start as early as Tuesday morning. The probability of tropical storm force winds is 80 to 100 percent. The probability of typhoon force winds is 40 to 60 percent. ...WIND INFORMATION... As Bolaven moves closer, the threat for sustained high winds will increase, first coming from the north to northwest on Tuesday, then shifting to west to southwest as Bolaven passes to the north Tuesday night. The latest forecast is for tropical storm force winds from late Tuesday morning to Wednesday morning and typhoon force winds from late afternoon to late evening, peaking at 65 to 75 mph, gusting to 90 mph or higher. A general concern should be for the possibility of moderate to major damage somewhere within the area. ...COASTAL INUNDATION AND SURF INFORMATION... Inundation of up to 6 feet is possible as Bolaven passes to the north, especially during high tide around 6 PM Tuesday evening. Hazardous surf conditions are possible beginning tonight and continuing through at least Thursday. The highest surf conditions are expected to begin along east and possibly south facing reefs on Tuesday as Bolaven nears. Surf will increase and likely become dangerous for north and west facing reefs on Wednesday as Bolaven passes to the northwest of the Marianas. ...INLAND FLOODING... A Flash Flood Watch is in effect for the entire area. See the latest forecast for the most up-to-date information. Listen for possible flood warnings for your location, and be ready to act if flooding rains occur. Soils are already wet from previous rainfall, so it won`t take much to cause flooding.
